(45) 130.2nd March, 1945.WAR CABINET.WORLD FOOD SUPPLIES.Memorandum by the Minister of Food.AS a separate document, W.P. (45) 109, I have submitted a brief apprecia-tion of the world position for certain foodstuffs in 1945. I should like this to beconsidered by the War Cabinet at an early date, in view of the difficulties I amexperiencing in obtaining supplies of food and the increasing demands of liberated countries.2. I propose (i) that the attention of the United States Government should be drawn tothe gravity of the position, with the proposal that a special enquiry should be made into military requirements;(ii) that the public of this country should be made aware of the position,either by a statement in the House of Commons, or in speeches by mycolleagues;(iii) that the Minister of Agriculture should draw the attention of farmers in this country to the situation, so that every effort may be made toavoid any fall in food production in this country;(iv) that the information contained in W.P. (45) 109 should be made availableto Dominion Governments so that they may consider how far they can contribute to relieving the present difficulties by reducing consumption and maintaining production.J. J. LL.Ministry of Food, W. 1,2nd March, 1945.[29343]-
